question.text:
Identify a, b, c, and d in the statements given below.

a. In ....a.... growth, both the progeny cells following mitotic cell division retain the ability to divide and continue to do so.

b. In ...b... growth following mitotic cell division, only one daughter cell continues to divide while the other differentiates and matures.

c. Arithmetic growth is mathematically expressed as .....c.....

d. The exponential growth can be expressed as ......d........

options.text: <math><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>, </mo><mi>b</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>, </mo><mi>c</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>, </mo><mi>d</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

<math><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>, </mo><mi>b</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>, </mo><mi>d</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>, </mo><mi>c</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

<math><mi>b</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>, </mo><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>, </mo><mi>c</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>, </mo><mi>d</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

<math><mi>b</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>, </mo><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>, </mo><mi>d</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>, </mo><mi>c</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>r</mi><mi>t</mi></math>

solution.text:
In arithmetic growth, following mitotic cell division, only one daughter cell continues to divide while the other differentiates and matures. Mathematically, it is expressed as Lt=L0+rt where Lt= length at time 't'

L0= length at time 'zero' and r = growth rate / elongation per unit time. The simplest expression of arithmetic growth is exemplified by a root elongating at a constant rate. In geometrical growth, both the progeny cells following mitotic cell division retain the ability to divide and continue to do so. . Mathematically, it is expressed as W1=W0ert where W1 = final size (weight, height, number etc.), W0 = initial size at the beginning of the period, r = growth rate, t = time of growth and e = base of natural logarithms
